thread.section_title: Otago Daily Times: Other Sports News
thread.title: Boxing: Parker 'ready to be tested'

title: Boxing: Parker 'ready to be tested'
text:
Boxing 
Joseph Parker has spent the past seven weeks practising keeping his left hand up high in preparation for tomorrow's fight against powerful veteran right-hander Kali Meehan. 
Bunkered down in his Las Vegas camp with trainer Kevin Barry, Parker sparred with 1.91m training partner Izu Ugonoh, in the hope of learning how to avoid and negate Meehan's 13cm reach advantage. 
"This is a big challenge for me because of the experience that Kali brings, his height, his reach, and the training camp has been awesome," said Parker. 
"With his [Ugonoh's] height and reach, he helped me to practise how to avoid getting hit by someone with long arms, and trying to get in there and land the punches I need to land to win the fight." 
Parker is well aware of Meehan's power and his ability to go the distance, and Barry believes his young charge is ready to be tested. 
"We have a lot of big guys coming up for Joe to fight as he moves forward and keeps developing and maturing," said Barry. "Kali's a big guy and it's the sort of fight that three years into his professional career, is the right fight for Joseph to have now." 
While Parker has been working hard to be ready for a long night in the office, he acknowledged both he and his opponent have the ability to end the bout quickly. 
"One punch can change anything." 
The 23-year-old shrugged off Meehan's recent comments that his son and training partner, Willis, packed a harder punch. 
"It's a matter of landing the punches. I respect what he says, and that's his opinion, but after the fight we'll see if he thinks I have power or not." 
- By David Skipwith of the New Zealand Herald
